Results of Salvia mirzayanii antifungal effect against the azole-resistant and azole-susceptible tested strains may be due to this fact that essential oils have different mechanisms of action in comparison to azole antifungal drugs. Cell membrane interaction is an important characteristic of hydrophobic essential oil and may be the main mechanism of this action.
28 Although the MIC value of essential oil on a panel of fungus is low, their application as antifungal therapeutic agents is restricted. Nevertheless, their lower side effects make them a source of novel natural antibiotics.
